Talks on the Enlightened Woman Mystic, Daya (Dayabai), an 18th century female mystic & poet.

Given from 11 Mar 1977 am to  20 Mar 1977am
in Chuang Tzu Auditorium, Pune (Poona)
and (an unfinished) Buddha Hall, Pune (Poona)
Discourse 	Hindi 

Only available as eBook? or audio.
eBook? the existence of the Rajneesh Foundation edition cannot be confirmed, so it can stay as unpublished for now.

translated from Hindi : Jagat Taraiya Bhor Ki (à¤œà¤—à¤¤ à¤¤à¤°à¥ˆà¤¯à¤¾ à¤­à¥‹à¤° à¤•à¥€)
 by Sw Anand Haridas & Sudha Joshi 
First published in year 2000.
It is not found this edition and it is classified as unpublished in Hindi. But here is English translation.

"As Osho insists: "These verses of Daya are unique. They can
bring a total revolution in your life. Daya says, 'A tiny spark of
fire burns the greatest forest.' If even a tiny spark of these verses
falls into you, your darkness will be completely destroyed."
Come, come further."
Anand Haridas
and Sudha Joshi
